result.execSummary:
The defendant Mathew E. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Entry into/onto Bldg/Constuct.Site/Room [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.15(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:14 p.m. Defendant Mathew E. Smith in court with attorney David Vernon Penn.  Defendant Mathew E. Smith in custody.  Mary M Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf278 and 15cm222. Also calling 17cf272, 16cm342, 16cm172, 17cf272, 16CT39. 
In 15cf278 and 15cm222 - Penn states he is still counsel on revocation matters. Parties in receipt of revocation packets. Sowinski/Penn/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
15cf278
Count 1
Jail - 9 months - CS to 15cm244

Count 2 
6 months - CC to Count 1; CS 15cm244


15cm222
Count 1
Jail - 6 months - CS to 15cf278

Count 2
Jail - 6 months - CC to Count 1 and CS to 15cf278

Count 3
Jail - 3 months - CS to Counts 1 and 2

Court takes judicial notice of 15cm244 - since sentences are consecutive - no additional time served is entitiled in these matters. Court speaks to defendant's letter re time served. 
Any financial obligations are reduced to civil judgment. Appeal rights given.

Court grants Motion to Withdraw effective upon the date new counsel is obtained. Status conference scheduled for Monday, February 19, 2018 at 3:30 p.m. Attorney Penn is excused from appearance if new counsel has not been appointed. 

Penn moves for modification of bond; Defendant statement to no contact provision while at jail. Court explains no contact bond provision. 
Adj. 3:49 p.m.
Striking document filed by defendant
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 25, 2018 at 03:00 pm.
from defendant regarding jail credit
includes revocation summary and cover letter

per Jack @ ONSO - in custody - ONSO
(WF added)

records.addlTxt: Defendants notice of cert - not deliverable as addressed -
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

2:33 p.m. Defendant Mathew E. Smith in court with attorney Robert Elwood Hanson.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend Count 1 to entry into a locked dwelling, a violation of 943.15 - a Class A Misdemeanor - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea to Counts 1 and 2.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig/Hanson/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 2 years - CC with any current supervision
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Jail credit - 
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Special disposition under 973.015 if successfully completes probation and pays all costs/fines/surcharges in full. 
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 2:51 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
State's Reply to Discovery continued - originally filed in case 15cf218 - moved on 04-12-16

3:46 p.m. Defendant Mathew E. Smith in court with attorney Robert Elwood Hanson.  Defendant Mathew E. Smith in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State files Information. Hanson - waives preliminary hearing -   Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Hanson in receipt of Information - waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas to all counts. Adj. 3:50 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

2:12 p.m. Defendant Mathew E. Smith in court  via video with attorney Robert Elwood Hanson.  Defendant Mathew E. Smith in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued. Adj. 2:14 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance at 12-09-2015 01:15 pm

1:17 p.m. Defendant Mathew E. Smith in court, via video, with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Mathew E. Smith in custody.   Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Voorhees states PD's office will be representing; Voorhees appears specially today but Attorney Hanson will be representing. Schiek/Voorhees statement to bond. Court sets $ sig bond. Adj. 1:25 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
